ConditionOverlapAssessment.description: Assessment of overlap between rule conditions

notes.description: Notes on condition overlap - e.g., "IPR000001 and IPR000002 both represent the same structural domain" or "FunFam subsumes the InterPro entry"

supported_by.description: Supporting text from literature for this assessment

ConditionOverlapAssessment.title: ConditionOverlapAssessment

ConditionTypeEnum.description: Types of conditions in rule antecedents
ConditionTypeEnum.title: ConditionTypeEnum

CoreFunction.description: A core function is a GO-CAM-like annotation of the core evolved functions of a gene. This is a synthesis of the reviewed core annotations, brought together into a unified GO-CAM-like representation.
CoreFunction.title: CoreFunction

EmbeddedRule.description: An embedded representation of an ARBA or UniRule for storage in YAML. Captures the essential structure: conditions (antecedent) and GO annotations (consequent).

condition_sets.description: List of condition sets (OR-ed together). Each condition set is a conjunction (AND) of conditions. The rule fires if ANY condition set matches.

entries.description: Entry-centric view of all entities in the rule (domain conditions and GO terms). Each entry tracks its relationships (PREDICTS, PREDICTED_BY, EQUIV) to other entries.

go_annotations.description: GO terms assigned by this rule

ipr2go_redundancy.description: Analysis of redundancy with InterPro2GO mappings

modified_date.description: Date the rule was last modified

reviewed_protein_count.description: Number of reviewed (Swiss-Prot) proteins annotated by this rule

unreviewed_protein_count.description: Number of unreviewed (TrEMBL) proteins annotated by this rule

EmbeddedRule.title: EmbeddedRule

EntryRelationshipEnum.description: Type of relationship between entries in a rule
EntryRelationshipEnum.title: EntryRelationshipEnum

EntryTypeEnum.description: Type of entry in a rule review (domain/family condition or GO term target)
EntryTypeEnum.title: EntryTypeEnum

EvidenceType.description: Gene Ontology evidence codes mapped to Evidence and Conclusion Ontology (ECO) terms
EvidenceType.title: EvidenceType

ExistingAnnotation.description: An existing annotation from the GO database, plus a review of the annotation.

evidence_type.description: Evidence code (e.g., IDA, IBA, ISS, TAS)

retired.description: Whether the annotation is retired or replaced

ExistingAnnotation.title: ExistingAnnotation

Experiment.description: A suggested experiment to answer a question about the gene

description.description: Detailed description of the experiment to be performed

experiment_type.description: Type of experiment or assay to answer the question

Experiment.title: Experiment

Finding.description: A finding is a statement about a gene, which is supported by a reference. Similar to "comments" in uniprot

full_text_unavailable.description: Whether the full text is unavailable

reference_section_type.description: Type of section in the reference (e.g., 'ABSTRACT', 'METHODS', 'RESULTS', 'DISCUSSION')

statement.description: Concise statement describing an aspect of the gene

supporting_text.description: Supporting text from the publication. This should be exact substrings. Different substrings can be broken up by '...'s. These substrings will be checked against the actual text of the paper. If editorialization is necessary, put this in square brackets (this is not checked). For example, you can say '...[CFAP300 shows] transport within cilia is IFT dependent...'

Finding.title: Finding

GOBiologicalProcessEnum.description: A biological process term in the GO ontology
GOBiologicalProcessEnum.title: GOBiologicalProcessEnum

GOCellularLocationEnum.description: A cellular location term in the GO ontology (excludes protein-containing complexes)
GOCellularLocationEnum.title: GOCellularLocationEnum

GOMolecularActivityEnum.description: A molecular activity term in the GO ontology
GOMolecularActivityEnum.title: GOMolecularActivityEnum

GOProteinContainingComplexEnum.description: A protein-containing complex term in the GO ontology
GOProteinContainingComplexEnum.title: GOProteinContainingComplexEnum

notes.description: Notes on specificity - suggested alternative terms if too broad/narrow

supported_by.description: Supporting text from literature for this assessment

GOTermEnum.description: A term in the GO ontology
GOTermEnum.title: GOTermEnum

product_type.description: Type of gene product (protein, ncRNA, etc.)

proposed_new_terms.description: Proposed new ontology terms that should exist but don't

status.description: Overall status of the gene review

suggested_questions.description: Suggested questions to ask experts about the gene. Only include if not obvious from the literature.

tags.description: Tags associated with the gene for categorization and organization

GeneReviewStatusEnum.description: Status of the gene review process
GeneReviewStatusEnum.title: GeneReviewStatusEnum

InterPro2GORedundancy.description: Analysis of whether rule GO annotations are redundant with existing InterPro2GO mappings from the GO Consortium.

novel_annotations.description: GO IDs not found in InterPro2GO for any rule condition

redundant_annotations.description: GO annotations that already exist in InterPro2GO

InterPro2GORedundancy.title: InterPro2GORedundancy

InterProTypeEnum.description: InterPro entry types categorizing protein signatures
InterProTypeEnum.title: InterProTypeEnum

LiteratureSupportAssessment.description: Assessment of literature support for the rule

notes.description: Notes on literature support - key papers, gaps in evidence

supported_by.description: Supporting text from literature for this assessment

LiteratureSupportAssessment.title: LiteratureSupportAssessment

LiteratureSupportEnum.description: Level of literature support for the rule
LiteratureSupportEnum.title: LiteratureSupportEnum

ManuscriptSection.description: Sections of a scientific manuscript or publication
ManuscriptSection.title: ManuscriptSection

OverlapInterpretationEnum.description: Automated interpretation of domain overlap patterns
OverlapInterpretationEnum.title: OverlapInterpretationEnum

PairwiseOverlap.description: Overlap statistics between two domain conditions (InterPro, FunFam, etc.) in the same condition set. Provides set difference metrics to measure uniqueness and redundancy.

a_minus_b_count.description: Number of proteins in A but not in B (|A - B|). Represents the uniqueness of A with respect to B. High value = A adds unique coverage beyond B. Zero value = A is completely contained in B (A ⊆ B).

b_minus_a_count.description: Number of proteins in B but not in A (|B - A|). Represents the uniqueness of B with respect to A. High value = B adds unique coverage beyond A. Zero value = B is completely contained in A (B ⊆ A).

condition_a_in_sets.description: List of 1-based condition set indices where condition A appears

condition_b_in_sets.description: List of 1-based condition set indices where condition B appears

containment_a_in_b.description: Proportion of A contained in B: |A ∩ B| / |A|. 1.0 means A is completely contained in B (A ⊆ B).

containment_b_in_a.description: Proportion of B contained in A: |A ∩ B| / |B|. 1.0 means B is completely contained in A (B ⊆ A).

count_a.description: Number of proteins matching condition A in specified database

count_b.description: Number of proteins matching condition B in specified database

intersection_count.description: Number of proteins matching BOTH A AND B (|A ∩ B|) in specified database

jaccard_similarity.description: Jaccard similarity coefficient: |A ∩ B| / |A ∪ B| = intersection / (count_a + count_b - intersection). 0.0 = no overlap, 1.0 = complete overlap.

protein_database.description: Which protein database was queried (SWISSPROT or TREMBL)

PairwiseOverlap.title: PairwiseOverlap

ParsimonyAssessment.description: Assessment of rule parsimony (simplicity vs complexity)

notes.description: Notes on parsimony - e.g., which conditions are redundant

supported_by.description: Supporting text from literature for this assessment

ParsimonyAssessment.title: ParsimonyAssessment

ParsimonyEnum.description: Assessment of rule parsimony (simplicity vs complexity)
ParsimonyEnum.title: ParsimonyEnum

ProposedOntologyTerm.description: A proposed new ontology term that should exist but doesn't currently

justification.description: Justification for why this term is needed

proposed_definition.description: Proposed definition for the new term

proposed_mappings.description: Proposed mappings to equivalent terms in other ontologies

proposed_name.description: Proposed name for the new term

proposed_parent.description: Proposed parent term in the ontology hierarchy

ProposedOntologyTerm.title: ProposedOntologyTerm

ProteinDatabaseEnum.description: Protein database types for rule analysis
ProteinDatabaseEnum.title: ProteinDatabaseEnum

Question.description: A question to be answered about the gene

experts.description: Experts to answer the question. These should be drawn from the authors of relevant publications already referenced. If no suitable experts are available, it's OK to leave this as an empty list!

Question.title: Question

ROTermEnum.description: A term in the relation ontology
ROTermEnum.title: ROTermEnum

RedundantAnnotation.description: A GO annotation that is redundant with an existing InterPro2GO mapping

interpro_source.description: InterPro ID that already maps to this GO term in ipr2go

RedundantAnnotation.title: RedundantAnnotation

Reference.description: A reference is a published text  that describes a finding or a method. References might be formal publications (where the ID is a PMID), or for methods, a GO_REF. Additionally, a reference to a local ad-hoc analysis or review can be made by using the `file:` prefix.

full_text_unavailable.description: Whether the full text is unavailable

is_invalid.description: Whether the reference is invalid (e.g., retracted or replaced)

Reference.title: Reference

RelatedEntry.description: A relationship from this entry to another entry in the rule. Categorized as PREDICTS (this → other), PREDICTED_BY (other → this), or EQUIV (bidirectional).

containment.description: Containment score (0-1) for the directional relationship. For PREDICTS: this_in_target (how much of this is contained in target). For PREDICTED_BY: target_in_this (how much of target is contained in this). For EQUIV: max of both directions.

exclusive_count.description: Number of proteins exclusive to the "source" of the relationship. For PREDICTS: proteins in this but not target. For PREDICTED_BY: proteins in target but not this. For EQUIV: proteins in this but not target (A - B).

intersection_count.description: Number of proteins in both this and target

RelatedEntry.title: RelatedEntry

Review.description: A review of an existing annotation.

proposed_replacement_terms.description: If the action is MODIFY, then this is a list of proposed replacement terms

Review.title: Review

RuleCondition.description: A single condition in a rule antecedent

interpro_type.description: InterPro entry type (family, domain, active_site, etc.). Only populated for InterPro conditions (condition_type = INTERPRO). Extracted from InterPro metadata or API.

negated.description: Whether this is a negative condition (NOT)

protein_count.description: Number of proteins matching this condition in specified database. Only populated for domain/family conditions (InterPro, FunFam, PANTHER). Null for taxon and other condition types.

protein_database.description: Which protein database was queried (e.g., SWISSPROT, TREMBL). Defaults to SWISSPROT (reviewed proteins only). Important to specify since counts differ dramatically between databases.

sample_proteins.description: Sample UniProt IDs matching this condition. Only included when protein_count < 20 to avoid bloating files. Limited to max 10 examples.

uniqueness_score.description: Measure of domain uniqueness (0.0 to 1.0). Calculated as 1.0 - mean(containment in other domains in same condition set). High score = more unique/specific domain. Low score = broad domain that commonly co-occurs.

RuleCondition.title: RuleCondition

RuleConditionSet.description: A set of conditions that must ALL be true (conjunction/AND). Multiple condition sets in a rule are OR-ed together (disjunction).

conditions.description: Conditions in this set (all must match)

notes.description: Reviewer notes on this specific condition set

number.description: 1-based condition set number (CS1, CS2, CS3, etc.)

pairwise_overlap.description: Pairwise overlap statistics for domain conditions in this set. Only computed for InterPro, FunFam, PANTHER conditions. Provides set difference metrics (uniqueness) and Jaccard similarity.

RuleConditionSet.title: RuleConditionSet

RuleGOAnnotation.description: A GO annotation produced by the rule
RuleGOAnnotation.title: RuleGOAnnotation

RuleReview.description: A review of a UniProt annotation rule (ARBA or UniRule). Each review covers ONE rule and assesses its quality, literature support, and biological appropriateness.

condition_overlap.description: Assessment of overlap between rule conditions

confidence.description: Overall confidence in the rule (0.0 to 1.0)

literature_support.description: Assessment of literature support for the rule

parsimony.description: Assessment of rule parsimony (simplicity vs complexity)

review_summary.description: Overall summary of the review findings

suggested_modifications.description: Specific modifications suggested if action is MODIFY

supported_by.description: Supporting text from literature for this review

RuleReview.title: RuleReview

RuleReviewEntry.description: An entity in the rule - either a domain/family condition or a GO term target. Each entry tracks its relationships (predictions, predicted-by, equivalence) to other entries.

appears_in_condition_sets.description: Which condition sets (1-based) contain this entry (for domain conditions only)

asserted_predicted_go_terms.description: GO terms that this entry maps to via external mappings (e.g., ipr2go). Only populated for external entries not in the rule's condition sets.

protein_count.description: Number of proteins matching this condition (from SwissProt)

related_entries.description: Relationships to other entries in the rule

source.description: Source of this entry if external to the rule (e.g., 'ipr2go' for InterPro entries that map to the same GO term via InterPro2GO but are not part of any condition set)

type.description: Type of entry (INTERPRO, FUNFAM, PANTHER, GO_TERM, etc.)

RuleReviewEntry.title: RuleReviewEntry

SupportingTextInReference.description: A supporting text in a reference.

full_text_unavailable.description: Whether the full text is unavailable

reference_section_type.description: Type of section in the reference (e.g., 'ABSTRACT', 'METHODS', 'RESULTS', 'DISCUSSION')

supporting_text.description: Supporting text from the publication. This should be exact substrings. Different substrings can be broken up by '...'s. These substrings will be checked against the actual text of the paper. If editorialization is necessary, put this in square brackets (this is not checked). For example, you can say '...[CFAP300 shows] transport within cilia is IFT dependent...'

SupportingTextInReference.title: SupportingTextInReference

notes.description: Notes on taxonomic scope - suggested changes to taxon constraints

supported_by.description: Supporting text from literature for this assessment

Term.description: A term in a specific ontology

id.description: An OBO CURIE for a term in GO, CL, CHEBI, etc.

Term.title: Term

TermMapping.description: A mapping between the proposed term and an equivalent term in another ontology

target_term.description: The target term in another ontology

TermMapping.title: TermMapping

product_type.description: Type of gene product (protein, ncRNA, etc.)

proposed_new_terms.description: Proposed new ontology terms that should exist but don't

status.description: Overall status of the gene review

suggested_questions.description: Suggested questions to ask experts about the gene. Only include if not obvious from the literature.

tags.description: Tags associated with the gene for categorization and organization
